Identifying Characteristics: Elongate fish with dorsal and anal fin located far back near the forked caudal fin
Operculum scaled on upper half only
Dark spots typically arranged vertically on lighter colored body
7 to 11 pairs of sensory pores along the underside of the lower jaw
Biology: Spawn in mid to late May, when water temperature approach 50F
Size: Muskellunge in excess of 30 pounds have been caught in Maine
Habitat: Prefer shallow water habitat with dense stand of submerged aquatic vegetation
Range: Range: eastern North America from Ontario and Quebec to Georgia
